verses.text_plain: Make haste, O God, to deliver me; make haste to help me, O Lord.
verses.verse_html:
1Make haste, O God, to deliver me; make haste to help me, O Lord. ▼
▼ to help…: Heb. to my help

tokens.definition: אֱלֹהִים ʼĕlôhîym, el-o-heem'; plural of H433 ; gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative:—angels, × exceeding, God (gods) (-dess, -ly), × (very) great, judges, × mighty.

verses.text_plain: Let them be ashamed and confounded that seek after my soul: let them be turned backward, and put to confusion, that desire my hurt.
verses.verse_html: 2Let them be ashamed and confounded that seek after my soul: let them be turned backward, and put to confusion, that desire my hurt.

tokens.definition: בּוּשׁ bûwsh, boosh; a primitive root; properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed:—(be, make, bring to, cause, put to, with, a-) shamed(-d), be (put to) confounded(-fusion), become dry, delay, be long.

verses.text_plain: Let them be turned back for a reward of their shame that say, Aha, aha.
verses.verse_html: 3Let them be turned back for a reward of their shame that say, Aha, aha.

verses.text_plain: But I am poor and needy: make haste unto me, O God: thou art my help and my deliverer; O Lord, make no tarrying.
verses.verse_html: 5But I am poor and needy: make haste unto me, O God: thou art my help and my deliverer; O Lord, make no tarrying.

tokens.definition: עָנִי ʻânîy, aw-nee'; from H6031 ; (practically the same as H6035 , although the margin constantly disputes this, making H6035 subjective and objective); depressed, in mind or circumstances:—afflicted, humble, lowly, needy, poor.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: poor (58x), afflicted (15x), lowly (1x), man (1x), variant (3x).
outline: poor, afflicted, humble, wretched poor, needy poor and weak poor, weak, afflicted, wretched humble, lowly

tokens.definition: אֶבְיוֹן ʼebyôwn, eb-yone'; from H14 , in the sense of want (especially in feeling); destitute:—beggar, needy, poor (man).
tokens.kjv_translation_count: needy (35x), poor (24x), beggar (1x), poor man (1x).
outline: in want, needy, chiefly poor, needy person
needing help, deliverance from trouble, especially as delivered by God

tokens.definition: חוּשׁ chûwsh, koosh; a primitive root; to hurry; figuratively, to be eager with excitement or enjoyment:—(make) haste(-n), ready.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: haste (19x), ready (1x).
outline: to haste, make haste, hurry (Qal) to make haste (Hiphil) to show haste, act quickly, hasten, come quickly to enjoy, be excited
(Hiphil) to show haste, act quickly, hasten, come quickly to enjoy, be excited
to show haste, act quickly, hasten, come quickly

tokens.definition: אֱלֹהִים ʼĕlôhîym, el-o-heem'; plural of H433 ; gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative:—angels, × exceeding, God (gods) (-dess, -ly), × (very) great, judges, × mighty.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: God (2,: 346x), god (244x), judge (5x), GOD (1x), goddess (2x), great (2x), mighty (2x), angels (1x), exceeding (1x), God-ward (with H 4136) (1x), godly (1x).
outline: (plural) rulers, judges divine ones angels gods
(plural intensive - singular meaning) god, goddess godlike one works or special possessions of God the (true) God God
works or special possessions of God

tokens.definition: עֵזֶר ʻêzer, ay'-zer; from H5826 ; aid:—help.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: help (19x), help meet (2x).
outline: help, succour help, succour one who helps

tokens.definition: פָּלַט pâlaṭ, paw-lat'; a primitive root; to slip out, i.e. escape; causatively, to deliver:—calve, carry away safe, deliver, (cause to) escape.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: deliver (16x), deliverer (5x), calveth (1x), escape (2x), safe (1x).
outline: to escape, save, deliver, slip away (Qal) to escape (Piel) to bring into security, deliver to cause to escape, cast forth to be delivered to slip away (Hiphil) to bring into security, bring to safety
(Piel) to bring into security, deliver to cause to escape, cast forth to be delivered to slip away
to cause to escape, cast forth
(Hiphil) to bring into security, bring to safety

tokens.pos: proper noun with reference to deity
tokens.definition: יְהֹוָה Yᵉhôvâh, yeh-ho-vaw'; from H1961 ; (the) self-Existent or Eternal; Jeho-vah, Jewish national name of God:—Jehovah, the Lord. Compare H3050 , H3069 .
tokens.kjv_translation_count: LORD (6,: 510x), GOD (4x), JEHOVAH (4x), variant (1x).
outline: Jehovah = "the existing One" the proper name of the one true God unpronounced except with the vowel pointings of H 136
the proper name of the one true God unpronounced except with the vowel pointings of H 136
unpronounced except with the vowel pointings of H 136

tokens.definition: אָחַר ʼâchar, aw-khar'; a primitive root; to loiter (i.e. be behind); by implication to procrastinate:—continue, defer, delay, hinder, be late (slack), stay (there), tarry (longer).
tokens.kjv_translation_count: tarry (7x), defer (3x), slack (2x), continue (1x), delay (1x), hinder (1x), stayed there (1x), sit up late (1x).
outline: to delay, hesitate, tarry, defer, remain behind (Qal) to delay, tarry (intensive) to cause one to delay, hinder, keep back (Piel) to delay, wait, stay behind (but not in hope)
(Qal) to delay, tarry (intensive) to cause one to delay, hinder, keep back
to cause one to delay, hinder, keep back
(Piel) to delay, wait, stay behind (but not in hope)
